description.narrative: SWDC work with the community level and with individual women in obtaining their rights, coordinate district processes with women’s organisations, mobilize women workers to collectively advocate for women's labour rights in the district, and carry out advocacy. Sri Lanka has higher gender-related socio-economic indicators compared with other South Asian countries. 90% of women are literate and maternal and child mortality is very low such as women's rights such as substantive equality for women, particularly in relation to leadership, decision-making and autonomy. Women's representation in local government bodies and parliament is less than 5%. The objectives are; Enhancing social justice for women focusing on Violence and human rights and legal reform for timely justice; Ensuring Democracy & civic engagement for women focusing work towards greater women’s participation within decision making bodies including the Local Government and Parliament; and Ensuring Women’s Economic Rights. The main activities include lobbying with lawyers at the district and national level, working closely with the National Violence against Women Task Force and supporting women’s access and right to information. Specific activities will include continuous discussions with women survivors and their families, psychosocial support/special counselling sessions with women survivors, supporting collective space for survivors, information sharing discussions on the national level TJ process. The expected results; more stable families, significant reduction in violence against women, empowered women working on accountability, economic rights of women in the informal economy recognized, women social status uplifted social and financially, better understanding created in the society on women rights and women who have experience violence become empowered through the use of creative and collective space. Thematic areas – women & social justice; Democracy & Civic Engagement; and Economic Rights
This project mainly contributes to results within Combating gender based violence. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
